IDiscussionboardContentFlag.IRequest.description: Request payload for filtering and listing content flags in the DiscussionBoard moderation system. Allows moderators/admins to search by actor, target, flag type, automation, and time.

limit.description: Number of records per page.

records.description: Total number of records in the result set.

IPage.IPagination.description: Pagination meta-type for DiscussionBoard entity list endpoints. Includes page cursor, size, record total, and page count. See IPage generic pattern.

id.description:
Primary Key. Unique identifier for each tag proposal.

This is the atomic ID for referencing the tag proposal record in all moderation, admin workflow, and business logic layers. It is stored as a UUID and ensures 3NF normalization by not duplicating or calculating information elsewhere. Used in querying, audit logs, and reviewing proposals.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
Member's unique identifier (UUID) who is proposing the tag to the forum.

Links directly to the member (user) object. Fulfills business and audit requirements for tracing who proposed each tag and supporting accountability. Never nullable.

proposed_tag.description:
String value of the tag being proposed. Must be unique for each member proposal.

Carries the atomic tag label string that the proposing user entered. Used in tag creation flows, moderation, and anti-abuse logic. Supports uniqueness constraints, profanity filtering, and business validation at the API/business layer.

created_at.description:
Creation timestamp for when the tag proposal was submitted.

Supports audit/lifecycle flows for the tag curation system, rate-limiting logic for proposals, and analytics. Always present.

IDiscussionboardTagProposal.description:
Discussion Board Tag Proposal entity representing an atomic proposal for a new topic tag to be added to the curated set.

Refer to the requirements regarding curated tags and proposal/approval moderation flow. This model is normalized and tracks proposals per member for audit, curation, and abuse prevention. Every tag proposal is linked to its proposing member, supports rate-limiting and anti-abuse business logic, and enables end-to-end lifecycle tracking for tag onboarding.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
UUID of the member proposing the tag, fulfilling the business requirement to associate all proposals with an authenticated user.

Key for validation, curation review, and auditing.

proposed_tag.description:
String representing the tag being proposed for addition.

Ensures 3NF compliance. Uniqueness required (per member) and subject to moderation, profanity filtering, and system-wide tag policy. Examples: 'Elections', 'Macroeconomics', 'CampaignFinance'.

IDiscussionboardTagProposal.ICreate.description:
Request body schema for creating a new tag proposal.

Provided by a member submitting a new tag for moderator/admin review. Only authenticated, non-suspended members may create proposals. Used in rate-limiting and tag curation flows.

proposed_tag.description: Updated tag string for the proposal. Must comply with tag guidelines, maintain uniqueness per member, and be subject to all business and moderation filtering rules.

IDiscussionboardTagProposal.IUpdate.description:
Request body schema for updating an existing tag proposal.

Permits a member or privileged moderator/admin to change the string of a proposed tag before review. Must comply with tag naming, uniqueness, and community rules.

reported_by_member_id.description:
UUID of the reporting member (who filed the report), for filtering/search.

Aids in moderation review, audit, and rate-limiting reporting flows.

resolved_by_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator who resolved this report (if resolved). Useful for filtering by handler or admin in moderation dashboards.

status.description:
Moderation workflow status for filtering (e.g. 'pending', 'reviewed', 'actioned', 'dismissed').

Enforces search, queueing, and reporting flows per requirements.

target_post_id.description: UUID of target post, for searching reports by content. Supports reporting, audit, and moderation use-cases.

target_comment_id.description: UUID of the target comment for filtering comment-specific reports.

created_from.description: Lower-bound datetime for filtering reports created after this moment in time.

created_to.description: Upper-bound datetime for filtering reports created before this time.

page.description: Pagination: requested page number (1-based default).

limit.description: Pagination: number of reports per page (API and UI enforce reasonable per-request caps for system health).

IDiscussionboardReport.IRequest.description:
Request body schema for listing or searching moderation reports.

Enables paginated, filterable queries for all moderation reports. Supports queueing, batch review, and audit/reporting use-cases. Reference to business requirements for rate-limiting, workflow status, and moderation dashboard UX.

data.description: Array of report entities for the current result page.

IPageDiscussionboardReport.description:
Paginated search/list result for moderation reports (discussionboard_reports).

Contains queueable result items for moderation dashboards, analytics, and batch admin workflows. Used for implementation of audit trails and review logs.

id.description:
Primary Key. Unique identifier for each report entity.

Atomic UUID for referencing the report in all moderation, audit, and dashboard logic. Supports audit, appeals, and rate-limiting enforcement.

reported_by_member_id.description: UUID of the member who filed the report. Links to user account history, supports abuse/rate-limiting controls, and allows for statistical dashboards tracking reporting activity.

resolved_by_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator who resolved this report. Nullable if unresolved or resolution is automated. Business logic references audit, review, and transparency rules.

target_post_id.description: UUID of the reported post if this report targets a post. Null if not a post report.

target_comment_id.description: UUID of the reported comment if this report targets a comment entity. Null if not applicable.

reason.description:
Human-readable string reason for report (e.g., 'Spam', 'Hate Speech', or custom message).

Refer to content guidelines and moderation policy for required handling, audit, and evidentiary trace.

status.description:
Current workflow status (e.g., 'pending', 'reviewed', 'actioned', 'dismissed').

Enables queueing, automated handling, state transitions, and process tracking for the moderation team.

created_at.description: Timestamp for report creation. Supports audit trails, reporting, and appeals workflows.

resolved_at.description: When the report was resolved (null if unresolved/ongoing). For workflow tracking, audit, resolution, and transparency features.

IDiscussionboardReport.description:
Moderation Report entity representing a flagged post or comment as reported by a board member, tracked through resolution workflow.

Tracks detailed moderation, audit, and appeal status for reported posts or comments. Atomic record used in moderation dashboards, appeals, compliance records. All handling of report is governed by transparency, workflow, and logging business rules.

reported_by_member_id.description: UUID of the member filing the report, ensuring auditability and enforcing business validation/rate limit per user.

target_post_id.description: UUID of the post being reported (nullableâ€”must have either post or comment).

target_comment_id.description: UUID of the comment being reported (nullableâ€”must have either post or comment).

reason.description:
The reason for reporting (free-form or policy-guided string).

May be constrained by content policy, with predefined categories and/or custom entries.

IDiscussionboardReport.ICreate.description:
Request body schema for creating a new moderation report.

Member-supplied input for flagging content (post or comment) for review. Must satisfy business/logical enforcement for per-user rate-limiting, content validation, and correctness in targeting either post or comment but not both.

resolved_by_moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator who is resolving this report. Tracked for audit, transparency, and operational metrics.

status.description: Workflow status after resolution (e.g. 'reviewed', 'actioned', 'dismissed'). Enforced by moderation, audit, and analytics.

resolved_at.description: Timestamp marking when the report was resolved. Required for proper audit/compliance.

IDiscussionboardReport.IUpdate.description:
Request body schema for updating (resolving) a moderation report.

Supplies required information for closing, dismissing, or actioning the flagged content, meeting all compliance, audit, and transparency rules.

moderator_id.description:
UUID of the moderator whose actions are being queried/filtering.

Aids in accountability dashboards and audit logs.

action_type.description: Moderation action type filter (e.g. 'delete_post', 'issue_warning', etc). Enables search by type via dashboard, analytics, or audit review mechanisms.

target_type.description: Target entity type string (e.g. 'post', 'comment', 'member', 'tag'). Allows focused action review according to content or user affected.

target_id.description: UUID of the target entity in question (post/comment/member etc). For use in targeted event search flows.

page.description: Pagination: requested result page index (1-based).

limit.description: Pagination: number of logs per page (API and UI enforce per-request upper limits).

IDiscussionboardModerationLog.IRequest.description:
Request body schema for querying/paginating moderation logs.

Allows filtering by moderator, action type, target, and period for investigation, reporting, or analytics.

data.description: Array of moderation log entries for current page.

IPageDiscussionboardModerationLog.description:
Paginated moderation log result schema.

Carries array of log entities and full pagination info as required for audit review, dashboard query, and process analytics.

id.description:
Primary Key. Unique identifier for the moderation log entry.

Atomic reference for audit, investigation, and appeals workflows.

moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator who performed this action. Used for accountability, operational metrics, and appeals tracking.

target_member_id.description: UUID of the affected member if a user-targeted action (nullable where content-only actions are involved). Enables compliance, escalation ladders, contextual appeals.

target_post_id.description: UUID of affected post if action is related to a post (null otherwise). Nested targets handled in audit/business logic.

target_comment_id.description: UUID of affected comment if moderation activity is on a comment. Null for non-comment actions.

action_type.description: String code for log action (e.g. 'delete_post', 'suspend_member'). Categorical and used for operational analytics and audit clarity.

action_details.description: Extra information describing the moderation action. Null if not provided. Supports compliance, appeals reference.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the moderation event took place. For investigation/audit timelines.

IDiscussionboardModerationLog.description:
Moderation log entity representing moderator/admin actions for audit, analytics, and compliance recording.

Each event is standalone and atomic for legal, appeals, and governance requirements. References moderator, target entities (user, post, comment), log action and time, with optional additional detail.

moderator_id.description: UUID of the moderator creating the log event. Needed for accountability, auditing, and workflow linkage.

action_type.description:
String code for the type of moderation event performed (e.g., 'delete_post', 'warn_user').

Open string category enabling operational analytics, reporting, and flexibility in business rule extensions.

target_member_id.description: UUID of affected member, for user-directed actions. Null if event is not user-related.

target_post_id.description: UUID of affected post for content moderation events. Null if unrelated.

target_comment_id.description: UUID of affected comment entity. Null if unrelated to comment moderation.

action_details.description: Optional descriptive narrative explaining what was done, justification, or evidence/log trace. Used for appeals and compliance.

IDiscussionboardModerationLog.ICreate.description:
Request body schema for creating a moderator action log entry.

Enforced for all moderator/admin interventions (delete, suspend, warn, tag action, etc) to provide a traceable action trail per organizational, legal, and community governance requirements.

current.description:
Current page number in the result set.

1-based index, with value reflecting the returned dataset position. Applies to all paginated endpoints in DiscussionBoard APIs.

limit.description: The maximum number of results per page.

records.description: The total number of records in the full dataset that match the filter/search criteria before paging. Used to calculate total pagination and client-side UI.

pages.description: The total number of result pages, derived from records / limit (rounded up if needed).

IPage.IPagination.description:
Standard pagination information structure embedded as part of all paged list responses (see API doc comments for IPage<T>).

Refer to core documentation on paginated navigation, audit, and reporting flows.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
ID of the member (UUID) for whom to create notification settings. References the member entity in the database.

This is required for 1:1 linkage and permission enforcement. Ensures settings are applied to the correct user as mandated by privacy and audit requirements.

in_app_enabled.description:
Whether the member wants to receive in-app notifications for activities in the discussion board.

Controls system-side push of new/reply/mention/moderation/announcement events to the web/mobile client UI.

email_enabled.description:
If true, email notifications are delivered for events the member has enabled (e.g., replies, moderation updates, announcements).

Serves for opt-in/opt-out per GDPR and user privacy, fulfills business requirement for alert configuration.

reply_notification_enabled.description:
Whether the member should receive notifications (in-app/email) when someone replies to their posts, comments, or threads.

Implements key engagement flow required for personalized alerting.

mention_notification_enabled.description:
Controls receiving alerts when the member is @mentioned in posts/comments.

Required for engagement and complaint flows as described in user journeys and requirements analysis.

moderation_notification_enabled.description:
Whether the user should receive notifications relating to moderation (warnings, suspensions, moderation actions on their content).

Opt-in/opt-out is required for transparency per business and compliance rules.

announcement_notification_enabled.description:
Indicates if board announcements (global or per-board info, rule changes, etc.) should be pushed to this user.

Field supports member control of communication volume and legal notice requirements.

IDiscussionboardMemberNotificationSettin.description:
Schema for creating a new notification settings record for a DiscussionBoard member.

Implements business requirement for user preference and compliance with privacy regulations. Each property corresponds to toggles in the notification settings UI, giving members granular control over which notifications they wish to receive by channel or event type. All fields are atomic and map directly to the Prisma schema for notification settings records.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
Optionally filters by member ID (UUID). Only retrieve settings for this member if set.

Used in admin dashboards or for analytics.

in_app_enabled.description:
Filter for members who have in-app notifications enabled (true) or disabled (false).

Supports segmentation and delivery targeting.

email_enabled.description: Filter settings where email delivery is enabled/disabled. Used for campaign targeting or opt-out reporting.

announcement_notification_enabled.description: If set, filters members by whether they have enabled announcement notifications. Used for regulatory delivery compliance.

page.description:
Page number for pagination (starts from 1).

Implements standard pagination for list or admin search UI.

limit.description:
Limit on number of results per page (default may be 100 or system-defined cap).

Helps with result batching and API performance.

IDiscussionboardMemberNotificationSettin.description:
Request schema for searching, filtering, or listing DiscussionBoard member notification settings.

Implements query logic as required for user list UIs, admin analysis, and API pagination. Derived directly from Prisma and OpenAPI operation requirements. All properties are optional search/aggregation criteria, with full compliance to original business rules and structure.

data.description: The main list of notification settings records for this response page.

IPageDiscussionboardMemberNotificationSe.description:
Container schema for paginated result sets of DiscussionBoard member notification settings list/search operations.

Follows the IPage<T> convention for OpenAPI pagination. Used for authentication and admin UI endpoints requiring result batching, total count metadata, and standard navigation structure as detailed in business and non-functional requirements.

in_app_enabled.description: Whether the member should receive notifications via in-app delivery. Fulfills UI toggle and opt-in/out flows.

email_enabled.description: If true, email notification delivery is enabled for this member. Supports user self-service for privacy and delivery compliance.

reply_notification_enabled.description: Enable/disable notifications when user receives replies to their posts/comments.

moderation_notification_enabled.description: If true, user will be alerted on moderation events affecting them.

announcement_notification_enabled.description: Whether board announcements are notified to this user.

discussionboardMemberNotificationSetting.description:
Schema for updating the notification delivery preferences for a member in the DiscussionBoard platform.

Used for in-app, email, and per-event-type notification toggles. All fields are optionalâ€”updates only supplied properties while preserving other values.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the notification settings record. Primary key in the Prisma schema.

This is required for settings record mutation, lookup, or audit trail referencing.

discussionboard_member_id.description:
UUID identifying the member whom this settings record belongs to. Fulfills 1:1 mapping, linking the settings to an individual user as enforced in the Actors domain data model.

Critical for user-driven preference and privacy enforcement.

in_app_enabled.description:
Indicates whether the member receives in-app notifications for the forum.

Atomic field, maps to personal delivery toggle as per business requirement.

email_enabled.description:
Shows whether email notifications are enabled for this user in the discussion board.

Supports GDPR and user privacy radio toggles in self-service UI.

reply_notification_enabled.description: If true, the member receives notifications on replies to their threads/posts/comments.

moderation_notification_enabled.description: Indicates if moderation action notifications (suspensions, warnings, content edits) are enabled.

announcement_notification_enabled.description: If true, site-wide or board-specific announcements are pushed to this member as notifications.

created_at.description:
Timestamp when this notification setting record was created. Set automatically at insert.

Required for compliance and retention audits.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp when settings were last updated. Used for audit trails and change history.

Supports rollback/history display in admin tools.

discussionboardMemberNotificationSetting.description:
Main representation of a DiscussionBoard member's notification delivery settings.

Each record is 1:1 tied to a user, with atomic fields for each event/channel toggle. Aligns with business rules for compliance, notification delivery engine, and user-centric opt-in/out control as detailed in the requirements analysis and Prisma schema comments. All fields are mandatory for DB integrity, reporting, and auditability.

id.description: ID of the notification settings record that was deleted. Always present for confirmation and audit trail linkage.

oneOf.description:
Status of the delete operation. Must be one of: 'success' (operation successful), 'not_found' (no record deleted), or 'error' (operation failed unexpectedly).

Implements API feedback for client and admin flows, as required by business rules.

Status of the delete operation. Must be one of: 'success' (operation successful), 'not_found' (no record deleted), or 'error' (operation failed unexpectedly).

Implements API feedback for client and admin flows, as required by business rules.

Status of the delete operation. Must be one of: 'success' (operation successful), 'not_found' (no record deleted), or 'error' (operation failed unexpectedly).

Implements API feedback for client and admin flows, as required by business rules.

result.description:
Status of the delete operation. Must be one of: 'success' (operation successful), 'not_found' (no record deleted), or 'error' (operation failed unexpectedly).

Implements API feedback for client and admin flows, as required by business rules.

deletedAt.description: Timestamp for when the notification settings record was deleted or marked deleted. Null if operation failed.

discussionboardMemberNotificationSetting.description:
API response schema for deletion of a member's notification settings.

Ensures standardization of feedback from delete endpoints, providing audit, compliance, and traceability of settings removal actions as required by privacy and data governance policies.

current.description:
Current page number (starting from 1).

Required for navigation and pagination logic.

limit.description:
Maximum entries per page (default 100 unless otherwise specified).

Used for controlling data window size and batching.

records.description:
Total number of records in the filtered set or table.

Supports client-side page logic and meta info in UI.

IPage.IPagination.description: Standard pagination metadata for API responses, as required for IPage<T> response containers throughout the system.

discussionboard_member_id.description: ID of the member to be promoted to admin. References a unique user in the Actors domain. Value must match an existing, active member's UUID. Required for establishing the admin relationship.

elevated_at.description: Timestamp for when admin privileges were granted to the member. This is a required, server-generated or client-provided ISO 8601 datetime indicating role elevation, supporting audit compliance as per business rules.

DiscussionBoardAdmins.ICreate.description: Object used to create a new admin assignment in the system. Based on discussionboard_admins Prisma table and relevant to role elevation operations. Aligns with business requirement for explicit privilege tracking and audit compliance.

elevated_at.description: The new timestamp for admin privilege assignment, if being changed. Must be ISO 8601 datetime. Used for correcting elevated role records or forced role recertification by system administrator.

DiscussionBoardAdmins.IUpdate.description: Object for updating the admin elevation record for a member in the admin system. Syncs with business audit and privilege recertification requirements for role management.

display_name.description: Display name string for filtering member profiles. Enables admin/moderator user search for a visible or preferred nickname. Optional, case-insensitive partial matches allowed.

joined_after.description: Find members who joined after this ISO 8601 datetime. Supports onboarding reports and retention queries.

joined_before.description: Find members who joined before this ISO 8601 datetime. Allows for time range user profile audits or stale account filtering.

page.description: Pagination: the page number (1-based).

limit.description: Pagination: maximum number of items to return per page.

DiscussionBoardMemberProfiles.IRequest.description: Request object for searching, filtering, and paginating member profiles (user profile domain). Used in admin/moderator profile list views for audit or search.

data.description: The array of member profile entities for the current page. Each is a profile object with all associated metadata.

DiscussionBoardMemberProfiles.IPage.description: Pagination container for member profile list queries. Extends standard IPage pattern with array of profile objects and page metadata.

id.description: Unique identifier for the member profile. This is the primary key of the discussionboard_member_profiles table. Required for linking to the member and for all profile operations.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member who owns this profile. Foreign key into the members domain. Supports 1:1 relationships and profile authorization logic.

oneOf.description: Optional, user-specified display name. Can be null if not set or privacy opted out. Used for personalization, mentions, and visibility/search.

display_name.description: Optional, user-specified display name. Can be null if not set or privacy opted out. Used for personalization, mentions, and visibility/search.

oneOf.description: Optional biography string (user-authored). Can be null if empty or privacy-protected. Allows rich text/markdown for expression, displayed in profile UI.

bio.description: Optional biography string (user-authored). Can be null if empty or privacy-protected. Allows rich text/markdown for expression, displayed in profile UI.

oneOf.description: Optional URI to avatar image, photo, or profile picture. May be null if unused, for privacy, or if not set. Used for visual personalization in UI; must point to valid and secure resource.

avatar_uri.description: Optional URI to avatar image, photo, or profile picture. May be null if unused, for privacy, or if not set. Used for visual personalization in UI; must point to valid and secure resource.

oneOf.description: User's personal or professional website URL. Optional, may be null for privacy. Supports https URIs, long enough for tracking/redirect URLs, and is displayed on profile if present.

website.description: User's personal or professional website URL. Optional, may be null for privacy. Supports https URIs, long enough for tracking/redirect URLs, and is displayed on profile if present.

oneOf.description: Optional user-supplied location info. Null if not set, otherwise shows a city, region, or custom string (no strict format). Used for community statistics and profile enrichment.

location.description: Optional user-supplied location info. Null if not set, otherwise shows a city, region, or custom string (no strict format). Used for community statistics and profile enrichment.

IDiscussionBoardMemberProfile.description: Represents a member profile in the system. Fully normalized object mapping to discussionboard_member_profiles, with all expressiveness and privacy fields documented. Required for displaying or modifying user profile information.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member who is creating this profile. Ensures 1:1 relationship between member and profile. Required and must map to an active member.

oneOf.description: Optional display name for the user profile. Can be null for privacy. Shows up in profile and search UI if present.

display_name.description: Optional display name for the user profile. Can be null for privacy. Shows up in profile and search UI if present.

oneOf.description: Optional bio/description. May include markdown. Null for suppressed or omitted.

bio.description: Optional bio/description. May include markdown. Null for suppressed or omitted.

oneOf.description: Optional avatar image URI. Users may omit for privacy or style reasons. Must be a valid URI or null.

avatar_uri.description: Optional avatar image URI. Users may omit for privacy or style reasons. Must be a valid URI or null.

oneOf.description: Optional website URI. Null if not set. Uses long string to support full web URLs.

website.description: Optional website URI. Null if not set. Uses long string to support full web URLs.

oneOf.description: Optional location string. Set to null for privacy or unspecified.

location.description: Optional location string. Set to null for privacy or unspecified.

IDiscussionBoardMemberProfile.ICreate.description: Properties required to create a new user profile. Used in profile creation flows, mapped to the profiles DB. Allows for partial/empty values for privacy.

oneOf.description: Updated or new display name. Null means remove or redact.

display_name.description: Updated or new display name. Null means remove or redact.

oneOf.description: Updated biography string. Null to clear value; markdown supported.

bio.description: Updated biography string. Null to clear value; markdown supported.

oneOf.description: New or updated avatar URI; null to clear avatar.

avatar_uri.description: New or updated avatar URI; null to clear avatar.

oneOf.description: New or updated website link; null to clear or suppress.

website.description: New or updated website link; null to clear or suppress.

oneOf.description: New or updated location string; null to clear or hide location.

location.description: New or updated location string; null to clear or hide location.

IDiscussionBoardMemberProfile.IUpdate.description: Update object for modifying member profile data. Fields are optional and may be set to null to clear; only provided values are changed. Used by member or admin/moderator interfaces.

id.description: UUID of the deleted profile. Used to reference or confirm the removed record.

status.description: Result of the deletion operation. Expected to be values such as 'deleted', 'not_found', 'error', following system operation conventions.

IDiscussionBoardMemberProfile.IDeleteRes.description: Result object returned after attempting to delete a member profile. Contains ID and status for client confirmation.

provider.description: Authentication provider, e.g., 'local', 'google', 'kakao'. Used for filtering credential entries. Optional, case-insensitive.

last_login_after.description: Optional ISO 8601 datetime restricting results to credentials used after a certain date/time.

last_login_before.description: Optional ISO 8601 datetime filtering records to those last used before a specific moment.

page.description: Pagination: page number.

limit.description: Pagination: maximum results per page.

IDiscussionBoardMemberAuthentication.IRe.description: Request object for searching or paginating member authentication records. Used mainly for admin troubleshooting or security audit screens.

data.description: Array of authentication records matching query/page. Each represents a unique member login credential.

IPageDiscussionBoardMemberAuthentication.description: Pagination container for authentication record list queries. Follows IPage contract; used in credential admin UIs.

id.description: Authentication record unique identifier. Primary key in the discussionboard_member_authentications table.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member's UUID. Associates this credential with a specific member and allows linking to the user domain.

provider.description: The authentication method/provider (e.g., 'local', 'google', 'kakao'). Enables login flows or debugging.

provider_identifier.description: Provider-unique identifier (username/email for local, external ID for OAuth). Used for authentication and account linking.

oneOf.description: Hashed credential (for local sign-ins). For OAuth/external, this will be null (never store password as cleartext). Security-critical. May be null if external login.

password_hash.description: Hashed credential (for local sign-ins). For OAuth/external, this will be null (never store password as cleartext). Security-critical. May be null if external login.

oneOf.description: Last successful login datetime (ISO 8601). Used for audit, SSO troubleshooting, and inactivity checks. Null if never used.

last_login_at.description: Last successful login datetime (ISO 8601). Used for audit, SSO troubleshooting, and inactivity checks. Null if never used.

IDiscussionBoardMemberAuthentication.description: Represents a member's authentication method. Used for login credential listings, auditing, and credential management. Fully normalized per security/business requirement.

discussionboard_member_id.description: UUID of the member for whom this credential will be created. Must correspond to an active user and allows linking multiple login types to a member account.

provider.description: Name of authentication provider (e.g., 'local', 'google'). Enforces login method uniqueness within the system.

provider_identifier.description: Provider-unique value; for local, the email/username; for SSO/OAuth, the provider-issued user ID or email.

oneOf.description: Securely stored hash for password (when applicable). Null if not storing password/using external login.

password_hash.description: Securely stored hash for password (when applicable). Null if not storing password/using external login.

IDiscussionBoardMemberAuthentication.ICr.description: Properties required to create a new member authentication credential. Used in account onboarding and credential add/remove flows.

limit.description: Number of records per page.

IPage.IPagination.description: Standard pagination metadata, as used in IPage containers across all entities.

IPageIDiscussionboardThreads.description:
A paginated list of thread records for the DiscussionBoard system.

This schema is used as a standard response for list APIs returning discussion threads, providing both an array of thread records and pagination metadata. The 'pagination' object describes page number, limits, total records, and total pages, while 'data' holds the thread entities. Reflects use cases for APIs that need to fetch multiple threads in a scalable fashion, supporting UI thread lists and administrative moderation workflows.

id.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each thread. See discussionboard_threads.id

discussionboard_board_id.description: Foreign key to Board (discussionboard_boards.id). Indicates which board this thread belongs to.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Foreign key to Member (discussionboard_members.id). The member who created this thread.

title.description: Thread title. See discussionboard_threads.title. Must be unique per board and descriptive for subject/content discovery. Supports advanced search UI.

oneOf.description: Optional thread description/body. See discussionboard_threads.description. Supports markdown for in-depth context at thread initiation. Nullable if no description.
Optional thread description/body. See discussionboard_threads.description. Supports markdown for in-depth context at thread initiation. Nullable if no description.

description.description: Optional thread description/body. See discussionboard_threads.description. Supports markdown for in-depth context at thread initiation. Nullable if no description.

status.description: Thread status (e.g. 'open', 'closed', 'locked'). See discussionboard_threads.status. Determines whether users can participate or view.

created_at.description: Thread creation timestamp (ISO 8601). Fulfills ordering/audit/log requirements. See discussionboard_threads.created_at.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp. Tracks edit history; reflects most recent change. See discussionboard_threads.updated_at.

oneOf.description: Soft-delete timestamp. If set, thread is considered deleted but retained for audit/data retention. See discussionboard_threads.deleted_at.
Soft-delete timestamp. If set, thread is considered deleted but retained for audit/data retention. See discussionboard_threads.deleted_at.

deleted_at.description: Soft-delete timestamp. If set, thread is considered deleted but retained for audit/data retention. See discussionboard_threads.deleted_at.

IDiscussionboardThreads.description:
Discussion thread entity for the DiscussionBoard platform, as defined in discussionboard_threads schema.

Represents a top-level topic within a board. Contains all atomic fields for UI, audit, and API management. The entity separates UI-visible data (title/description/status) from relational identifiers (board/member), with required timestamps for audit compliance.

discussionboard_board_id.description: Target board ID to which this thread will belong. Required.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Creator member ID. Required.

title.description: Thread title (must be unique within the board). Required.

oneOf.description: Optional thread description/body supporting markdown.
Optional thread description/body supporting markdown.

description.description: Optional thread description/body supporting markdown.

status.description: Initial thread status (e.g. 'open').

created_at.description: Timestamp of thread creation (ISO 8601 format).

IDiscussionboardThreads.ICreate.description:
Schema for creating a new thread entity on the DiscussionBoard.

Follows the requirements of discussionboard_threads for registration of a topicâ€”including links to board and member, title, (optional) description, initial status, and creation timestamp. Used as request body for thread creation endpoint.

title.description: New or updated thread title. If changed, must comply with board-uniqueness constraint.

oneOf.description: New thread description/body (markdown supported). Nullable.
New thread description/body (markdown supported). Nullable.

description.description: New thread description/body (markdown supported). Nullable.

status.description: New thread status ('open', 'closed', etc).

updated_at.description: Timestamp of last update (ISO 8601). Should correspond to edit action.

IDiscussionboardThreads.IUpdate.description:
Schema for updating an existing thread entity on the DiscussionBoard.

Permits updating the thread title, description/body, and status. 'updated_at' is required for audit and edit tracking. All properties are optional except updated_at, so only fields to be changed need be included.

discussionboard_thread_id.description: (Optional) Filter: posts belonging to specific thread ID.

discussionboard_member_id.description: (Optional) Filter: posts created by member.

created_at_from.description: (Optional) Filter: posts created after this date/time (ISO 8601).

created_at_to.description: (Optional) Filter: posts created before this date/time (ISO 8601).

page.description: Page number for pagination (starts from 1). Optional.

limit.description: Maximum number of posts per page. Optional.

sort.description: Sort order: e.g. 'created_at desc', 'created_at asc', 'updated_at desc'. Optional.

IDiscussionboardPosts.IRequest.description:
Request schema for searching/listing DiscussionBoard posts with filtering, pagination, and sorting.

Used as request body for post-listing endpoint, enables advanced queries for feeds, dashboards, and administration.

IPageIDiscussionboardPosts.description:
A paged response with list of DiscussionBoard posts for feeds or moderation views.

Provides required 'pagination' structure and data array as per IPage contracts, holding DiscussionBoard post entities for API responses.

id.description: Primary key (ID) for the post. See discussionboard_posts.id.

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Foreign key to thread. Which thread this post belongs to. See discussionboard_posts.discussionboard_thread_id.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Foreign key to member. Author of the post.

body.description: Main post content/body (markdown supported). Business field required for thread participation.

created_at.description: Post creation datetime (ISO 8601). For audit trails and ordering.

updated_at.description: Last post modification datetime.

oneOf.description: Soft-delete timestamp (nullable). If set, post is logically deleted in UI/API results.
Soft-delete timestamp (nullable). If set, post is logically deleted in UI/API results.

deleted_at.description: Soft-delete timestamp (nullable). If set, post is logically deleted in UI/API results.

IDiscussionboardPosts.description:
DiscussionBoard post entity. Defines all fields for core thread/post structures, links to thread/member, and auditing timestamps.

Used for direct display in APIs, UI, and audit/compliance reports. Conforms to discussionboard_posts table. 'body' is required and always markdown-capable.

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Thread ID to which this post is to be attached. Required.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member ID for the post author (required).

body.description: Post body/content (markdown supported). Required.

created_at.description: Timestamp of post creation.

IDiscussionboardPosts.ICreate.description:
Request body schema to create a new post in a discussion thread.

Represents all required input fields per DB and business logic: links to thread/member, content, and audit field for timestamp. Used in frontend post creation UI and backend APIs.

body.description: Updated post body/content (markdown supported).

updated_at.description: Timestamp of post update (ISO 8601, required for audit).

IDiscussionboardPosts.IUpdate.description:
Request body schema to update an existing discussion post.

Allows updating only the body/content and timestamp. Use for member edits and moderation. No other mutable fields.

id.description: Primary key for the post. See discussionboard_posts.id

discussionboard_thread_id.description: Thread ID this post belongs to.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member who authored the post.

body.description: Post body/content.

created_at.description: When the post was created.

updated_at.description: Last update time for post.

oneOf.description: If set, the post is deleted/hidden in the UI. Null otherwise.
If set, the post is deleted/hidden in the UI. Null otherwise.

deleted_at.description: If set, the post is deleted/hidden in the UI. Null otherwise.

IDiscussionboardPost.description:
DiscussionBoard post resource entity object. Used as response payload for post queries, including fetch by id and delete (soft-delete) return types.

Fields match discussionboard_posts DB entity: UUIDs for relations, markdown body, and standard audit timestamps (creation/update/deletion).

discussionboard_post_id.description: (Optional) Filter by parent post ID.

discussionboard_member_id.description: (Optional) Filter by member/author id.

parent_id.description: (Optional) Filter for comments that are replies to a specific comment (threaded discussion).

created_at_from.description: (Optional) Only comments created after this datetime.

created_at_to.description: (Optional) Only comments created before this datetime.

page.description: Results page number for pagination (optional).

limit.description: Maximum number of comments per page (optional).

sort.description: Sort criteria, e.g. 'created_at desc', 'created_at asc', 'updated_at desc' (optional).

IDiscussionboardComment.IRequest.description:
Request body schema for searching/listing comments (discussionboard_comments) with filters, search, and pagination.

Enables advanced queries for threaded forum display, admin review, and hierarchical UI.

IPageIDiscussionboardComment.description:
Paged response of DiscussionBoard comments, with thread/post context for each and pagination metadata for UI and backoffice moderation workflows.

Returns an array of comment entities for forum/audit/reporting views.

id.description: Primary key. Unique comment identifier. See discussionboard_comments.id.

discussionboard_post_id.description: Foreign key to post entity. The post this comment belongs to.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member who authored the comment (discussionboard_members.id).

oneOf.description: Parent comment ID for hierarchical/threaded replies. Null for top-level comments.
Parent comment ID for hierarchical/threaded replies. Null for top-level comments.

parent_id.description: Parent comment ID for hierarchical/threaded replies. Null for top-level comments.

body.description: Comment body/content in markdown. Requirement for UI display.

created_at.description: Date/time comment was created.

updated_at.description: Last update/edit timestamp of the comment.

oneOf.description: Soft-delete marker. If set, comment is considered deleted but present for audit/data retention.
Soft-delete marker. If set, comment is considered deleted but present for audit/data retention.

deleted_at.description: Soft-delete marker. If set, comment is considered deleted but present for audit/data retention.

IDiscussionboardComment.description:
DiscussionBoard comment entity object, mapping to discussionboard_comments DB schema.

Provides all fields necessary for rendering forum threads, enforcing audit, and supporting threaded/nested replies. Parent_id enables reply relationships, soft-delete tracks moderation/audit removal.

limit.description: Maximum number of records per page. Default is 100 for most APIs.

IPage.IPagination.description:
Page information metadata block for paginated API responses, as used throughout DiscussionBoard APIs.

Provides full details on page number, page size, total records, and total pages for consumers.

pagination.description: Pagination metadata object as defined by the OpenAPI standard. This provides detailed information about current page, total records, page limits and how the response was paginated. Referenced from standard IPage template.

data.description: Array of DiscussionboardContentFlag records for the current page. Each entry represents a single content flag as normalized in the moderation audit schema.

IPageIDiscussionboardContentFlag.description:
A page object for discussion board content flag moderation records. This type defines the paged list structure for flagged content in the system, supporting robust auditing of moderation actions. Corresponds to the IPage<T> structure with DiscussionboardContentFlag responses as the records. For full context, see flagging business rules in the Prisma schema and requirements analysis.

The purpose of content flag pagination is to allow efficient browsing, actionable dashboards for moderation staff, and compliance reviews for automated and manual flag triggers.

id.description: Primary key for the content flag record. This is a unique identifier for each individual flag instance. Referenced in other records for traceability and auditability.

oneOf.description: If a post was flagged, this property holds the unique identifier of the post. Nullable if the target is a comment. Ensures normalization by not mixing flag contexts.
If a post was flagged, this property holds the unique identifier of the post. Nullable if the target is a comment. Ensures normalization by not mixing flag contexts.

flagged_post_id.description: If a post was flagged, this property holds the unique identifier of the post. Nullable if the target is a comment. Ensures normalization by not mixing flag contexts.

oneOf.description: If a comment was flagged, this property contains the UUID for the comment. Nullable if the flag is for a post. Maintains atomic distinction between posts and comments as required by moderation schema.

If a comment was flagged, this property contains the UUID for the comment. Nullable if the flag is for a post. Maintains atomic distinction between posts and comments as required by moderation schema.

flagged_comment_id.description: If a comment was flagged, this property contains the UUID for the comment. Nullable if the flag is for a post. Maintains atomic distinction between posts and comments as required by moderation schema.

oneOf.description: The memberâ€™s unique identifier who flagged the content. Null if flag was created by automated system or directly by moderator.
The memberâ€™s unique identifier who flagged the content. Null if flag was created by automated system or directly by moderator.

flagged_by_member_id.description: The memberâ€™s unique identifier who flagged the content. Null if flag was created by automated system or directly by moderator.

oneOf.description: The moderatorâ€™s unique ID if the flag was set by manual moderation. Null if not manual or by system/member.
The moderatorâ€™s unique ID if the flag was set by manual moderation. Null if not manual or by system/member.

set_by_moderator_id.description: The moderatorâ€™s unique ID if the flag was set by manual moderation. Null if not manual or by system/member.

flag_type.description: Atomic type code describing why the content was flagged. Typical values: 'spam', 'profanity', 'abuse', 'automation', etc. Enum may be described externally by platform policy or admin configuration.

flagged_at.description: ISO-8601 timestamp recording exactly when the content flag was set. Fulfills audit/compliance requirement for moderation traceability.

auto_flagged.description: Indicates whether this flag was set by automated system (true) or manually by a user or moderator (false). Fulfills reporting and compliance business logic.

IDiscussionboardContentFlag.description:
Represents a single moderation-flag record for discussion board content. Closely models the discussionboard_content_flags table as described in the moderation domain and Prisma schema.

Flags may relate to posts or comments, and may be set by users, moderators, or automated rules for spam/abuse/profanity/etc. Used to power queue-based moderation interfaces and historical/audit views. The design supports strict normalization for compliance and deep analytics.

oneOf.description: If flagging a post, supply the unique identifier (UUID) for the post. Must not be filled if this flag is for a comment. Validated at API boundary according to content type.
If flagging a post, supply the unique identifier (UUID) for the post. Must not be filled if this flag is for a comment. Validated at API boundary according to content type.

flagged_post_id.description: If flagging a post, supply the unique identifier (UUID) for the post. Must not be filled if this flag is for a comment. Validated at API boundary according to content type.

oneOf.description: If flagging a comment, supply its UUID. Null for post-only flags.
If flagging a comment, supply its UUID. Null for post-only flags.

flagged_comment_id.description: If flagging a comment, supply its UUID. Null for post-only flags.

oneOf.description: ID of the member submitting the flag. If the flag is raised by an automated system or a moderator directly, leave null.
ID of the member submitting the flag. If the flag is raised by an automated system or a moderator directly, leave null.

flagged_by_member_id.description: ID of the member submitting the flag. If the flag is raised by an automated system or a moderator directly, leave null.

oneOf.description: ID of the moderator who sets the flag directly. Null for member/automatic/system flags.
ID of the moderator who sets the flag directly. Null for member/automatic/system flags.

set_by_moderator_id.description: ID of the moderator who sets the flag directly. Null for member/automatic/system flags.

flag_type.description: Required business-logic string specifying why content is flagged (spam, abuse, forbidden, etc.). Must follow platform moderation/business policy enumeration.

auto_flagged.description: If true, this flag is being set by an automated rule or system process. If false, set by a human (member or moderator) as allowed by business logic.

IDiscussionboardContentFlag.ICreate.description:
Request body for creating a new discussion board content flag. This input type matches the moderation business process as described in the requirements and Prisma schema (discussionboard_content_flags create).

Enforces clear separation between post/comment context, actor responsible for flagging, and reason/type. Supports both automated and manual flags. Validation distinguishes between automated, member, and moderator sources as well as content type.

oneOf.description: If needed, update the post reference for this flag (should only be used to correct or re-attribute context in rare moderation workflows).
If needed, update the post reference for this flag (should only be used to correct or re-attribute context in rare moderation workflows).

flagged_post_id.description: If needed, update the post reference for this flag (should only be used to correct or re-attribute context in rare moderation workflows).

oneOf.description: If required, reassign the target to a different comment. Extremely rare and meant for admin-level corrections.
If required, reassign the target to a different comment. Extremely rare and meant for admin-level corrections.

flagged_comment_id.description: If required, reassign the target to a different comment. Extremely rare and meant for admin-level corrections.

oneOf.description: Update the member referenceâ€”should only be used if originally recorded incorrectly. See business policy for editing flags.
Update the member referenceâ€”should only be used if originally recorded incorrectly. See business policy for editing flags.

flagged_by_member_id.description: Update the member referenceâ€”should only be used if originally recorded incorrectly. See business policy for editing flags.

oneOf.description: Update the assigned moderator if original flag was corrected. Only for moderation/admin use.
Update the assigned moderator if original flag was corrected. Only for moderation/admin use.

set_by_moderator_id.description: Update the assigned moderator if original flag was corrected. Only for moderation/admin use.

flag_type.description: Update/moderate the content flag reason (e.g., if misclassified or investigation reveals different flag type). Value must still conform to policy enumeration.

auto_flagged.description: Update whether the flag is marked as automatically set or not. Used in rare audit corrections or appeals.

IDiscussionboardContentFlag.IUpdate.description:
Update schema for a discussion board content flag record. Used by moderation/admin backend systems for correcting misflagged content or adjusting audit trails in rare workflows. All updates must be audit logged.

Modifications typically only allowed to privileged accounts and with business policy restrictions.

id.description: UUID of the deleted flag record.

deleted_at.description: Timestamp (ISO-8601) marking when the flag was (soft-)deleted from the content moderation queue.

success.description: Indicates whether the deletion of the flag was successful.

IDiscussionboardContentFlag.IDeleteRespo.description:
Response/result object for flag deletion endpoints. Returns details about the flag and the status of deletion for reliable audit and compliance monitoring according to moderation rules.

This type documents the evidence trail for recordkeeping, supporting both user feedback and regulatory reporting.

oneOf.description: Page number for paginated notification results. Optionalâ€”defaults to first page if not supplied.
Page number for paginated notification results. Optionalâ€”defaults to first page if not supplied.

page.description: Page number for paginated notification results. Optionalâ€”defaults to first page if not supplied.

oneOf.description: Optional. Number of notifications per page (system default may apply when absent).
Optional. Number of notifications per page (system default may apply when absent).

limit.description: Optional. Number of notifications per page (system default may apply when absent).

oneOf.description: Optional filter: type of notification (e.g., 'reply', 'mention', 'moderation', 'announcement'). Allows filtering by event category; see business rules for system notification types.
Optional filter: type of notification (e.g., 'reply', 'mention', 'moderation', 'announcement'). Allows filtering by event category; see business rules for system notification types.

type.description: Optional filter: type of notification (e.g., 'reply', 'mention', 'moderation', 'announcement'). Allows filtering by event category; see business rules for system notification types.

oneOf.description: Optional filter (true/false/null)â€”filters notifications by read/unread status if supplied. Null means all statuses are included.
Optional filter (true/false/null)â€”filters notifications by read/unread status if supplied. Null means all statuses are included.

read.description: Optional filter (true/false/null)â€”filters notifications by read/unread status if supplied. Null means all statuses are included.

oneOf.description: Optional. Lower time-bound for delivered_atâ€”used for filtering results by delivery date (ISO-8601 format).
Optional. Lower time-bound for delivered_atâ€”used for filtering results by delivery date (ISO-8601 format).

delivered_from.description: Optional. Lower time-bound for delivered_atâ€”used for filtering results by delivery date (ISO-8601 format).

oneOf.description: Optional. Upper time-bound for delivered_atâ€”used for date range filtering.
Optional. Upper time-bound for delivered_atâ€”used for date range filtering.

This is designed for administrative and navigation purposes, supporting management of channel visibility, status, and metadata. Relates to the discussionboard_channels Prisma table, returning multiple channel records and supporting advanced filters according to business requirements for platform segmentation and configuration.
operations.description:
This operation allows authenticated users (typically admins or moderators) to retrieve a list of channels available within the system. The endpoint supports querying by enabled status, text search on channel names or descriptions, pagination (page/limit), and sorting. It is built on the discussionboard_channels Prisma model, which holds top-level forum channels such as 'Politics', 'Economics', etc.

Access to this endpoint may be restricted based on user role, and actions are audited. The returned data is comprehensive, including all relevant channel properties for display or management, and reflects the current active/inactive (enabled) state. If the channel is soft-deleted (deleted_at is set), it may be hidden or marked as such depending on the request parameters.

This endpoint is commonly used for admin dashboards, configuration screens, and navigation menus. Related endpoints include creation, retrieval by id, update, and soft-delete of channels.

Authorization may be enforced to restrict access to certain roles (e.g., admin, moderator, possibly member if channel listing is public).

This endpoint provides complete details for use in editing screens, audit logs, or advanced configuration workflows. It checks for soft-deletion and will return appropriate error codes if the channel does not exist or access is unauthorized. Input must conform to required data shape defined in IDiscussionboardChannel.ICreate. Business rules such as unique code/name, audit requirements, and possibly moderation review are enforced. Soft-deleted previously existing codes are not automatically restored; new records are created unless a specific restoration endpoint is defined.

Upon successful creation, the endpoint returns the full new channel entity. Errors are returned for constraint violations, authorization failures, and malformed requests. Related endpoints: retrieve by id, update, patch list, and soft-delete operations.

This operation allows administrators to define or add a new key-value configuration that governs platform-wide settings. It is tied to the discussionboard_settings Prisma table. Settings include global flagsâ€”such as maintenance mode, notification preferences, allowed file typesâ€”and are strictly managed for audit compliance. Only admins are allowed to execute this operation. Key constraints: 'key' must be unique. The audit log must record the creation event, including actor/admin details. This operation does not allow users to configure personal notification settings (those are managed elsewhere).
operations.description:
This API endpoint allows platform administrators to create (insert) new rows into the discussionboard_settings table, which serves as the central repository for discussion board configuration options. Each setting controls some aspect of system-wide behaviorâ€”such as spam filtering thresholds, maintenance mode toggles, maximum attachment sizes, or SMTP server settings. 

The endpoint enforces uniqueness of the setting key. If the key already exists, a descriptive error is returned. The request body must provide all required information: key, value, and optionally a description. All actions performed through this endpoint are logged in the audit record to fulfill transparency and security requirements.

It allows members to modify their preferences for in-app notifications, email alerts, reply notifications, mention notifications, moderation updates, and board-wide announcements. The request body must supply the updated preference fields as defined in the schema. The operation enforces user authentication (member or admin) and validates that the record exists for the specified member ID. System logs actions for audit and compliance, and incorrect record access (e.g., editing someone else's settings without proper privilege) results in a 403 or 404 error. This endpoint adheres to business rules and fully complies with GDPR by respecting opt-in/opt-out requirements. Related endpoints include POST (creation), GET (retrieve single setting), and DELETE (removal/reset of preferences).
operations.summary: Update notification settings for a specific member (discussionboard_member_notification_settings table).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Target notification settings record's ID (memberNotificationSettingsId). Used to identify which member's notification preferences are being updated.

requestBody.description: The updated notification settings information for the member.

responseBody.description: The updated member notification settings record.

operations.specification: Deletes an existing notification settings record for a specific member. This operation removes the record from the discussionboard_member_notification_settings table, effectively resetting the member's notification delivery preferences to system defaults or removing all custom preferences. This is typically done when a user deactivates their account or chooses to reset notification settings via the UI. Only members or admins may perform this operation, as determined by access controls.
operations.description: This API operation deletes the notification settings record for a given member, as stored in the discussionboard_member_notification_settings table. It validates that the record exists and belongs to the currently authenticated user (unless performed by an administrator). Upon successful deletion, the system reverts the member's notification preferences to default behaviors or removes customizations entirely. All deletion events are logged in the system audit trail for compliance. Attempts to delete non-owned or non-existent records trigger a 403 or 404 error, per business logic. This endpoint upholds security, ensures data retention requirements are met, and supports self-service account management. Related endpoints include POST (creation), PUT (update), and GET (retrieve single setting).

IPageDiscussionboardMembers.description:
Paginated list of board member records.

This type provides a page of members along with pagination metadata, such as current page and total count, used for directory, admin overview, and advanced filtering. Aligns with standard IPage<T> container types.

id.description:
Unique member identifier. References the main user entity in the Discussion Board system (see discussionboard_members in Prisma schema).

Used as foreign key in profiles, authentications, posts, and moderation actions.

joined_at.description:
Member join date/time in ISO 8601 format. Indicates when the registration was successfully completed.

Aligns with audit and history requirements of the system.

status.description:
Current account status, e.g., 'active', 'pending', or 'suspended'. Business rules govern which APIs/features are available per status.

Reflects member enablement and privilege flows.

IDiscussionboardMembers.description:
Discussion Board member (user) entity type.

Captures the minimal identity fields for a system user and provides primary linkage for posts, authentications, and profile. Reflects core account state as defined in the discussionboard_members table.

joined_at.description:
The registration join date/time (ISO 8601). Must be provided by the API at registration time.

Required to fulfill audit/logging functions.

status.description:
Initial member status, typically 'active' or 'pending'.

Access rights and onboarding flow may depend on this value.

IDiscussionboardMembers.ICreate.description:
Request body schema for member registration.

Specifies the minimal properties needed when a new user is created in the system (see business rules for registration and onboarding).

status.description:
Member status field update. Allows for status transitions (e.g., 'suspended', 'active').

Typical use cases include admin- or system-triggered state changes. This is optional to allow partial updates.

IDiscussionboardMembers.IUpdate.description:
Member update payload.

Currently, only the status field is supported for direct update via this schema. Expansion possible in future versions.

member_id.description:
Optional: Filter moderator role assignments by specific member ID.

When provided, narrows search/query for moderators linked to a given member.

promoted_from.description:
Optional: Filter only moderator assignments promoted after this timestamp (ISO8601).

Used for administrative search tools and audit analytics.

promoted_to.description:
Optional: Only retrieve moderator assignments promoted before this timestamp (ISO8601).

Helps support range searches in dashboards and history views.

is_active.description: Optional: Filter for currently active moderator assignments (demoted_at is null).

DiscussionBoardModerators.IRequest.description:
Moderator list/search request schema.

Allows advanced filtering, paging, and search for moderator assignments via admin UI or API.

DiscussionBoardModerators.IPage.description:
Paginated result of moderator role assignments, including relevant metadata for navigation, sorting, and display.

Used for admin role management UIs and dashboards.

id.description: Unique moderator assignment record ID.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member's unique identifier (foreign key to members table).

oneOf.description: If present, date/time moderator was demoted (null if currently active).

demoted_at.description: If present, date/time moderator was demoted (null if currently active).

DiscussionBoardModerators.description:
Moderator role entity, includes reference to member, promotion/demotion state, and audit trail.

Matches the structure of discussionboard_moderators table in the Actors domain.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member's ID to promote to moderator. Must refer to an existing, eligible member account. Business rules prevent duplicate or concurrent roles per member.

promoted_at.description: Datetime when moderator role is assigned.

DiscussionBoardModerators.ICreate.description:
Request to create a moderator assignment by promoting a member.

Admin-initiated role elevation to moderator status.

demoted_at.description: If provided, marks this moderator role assignment as ended at the specified time. Supports soft demotion flows and privilege audits. Optional.

DiscussionBoardModerators.IUpdate.description:
Moderator role assignment update.

Used for demotion or privilege state changes tracked via this role entity.

member_id.description: Optional: Filter for admin role assignments belonging to a specific member. Used in broader role audits and assignment histories. Allows precise admin role lookup or targeted revocation workflows.

elevated_from.description: Optional: Restrict search to admins elevated after this date/time (ISO8601). Workflow for role review, escalation, and analytics.

elevated_to.description: Optional: Restrict detection to admins elevated before this date/time (ISO8601). Enables time-span-based analytics or review screens.

DiscussionBoardAdmins.IRequest.description:
Admin assignment search/list request object.

Designed for advanced access, audit, or reporting flows in role management features.

DiscussionBoardAdmins.IPage.description:
Paginated array of admin assignment records with metadata for navigation and analytics.

Standard admin list page wrapper.

id.description: Unique record identifier for admin role assignment. Uniquely identifies an admin role for a member.

discussionboard_member_id.description: Member account UUID linked to admin role. Foreign key to core actors table.

elevated_at.description: Datetime when admin privileges were granted. Used for audit, role traceability, and privilege management.

DiscussionBoardAdmins.description:
Admin role assignment entity schema. Refers to a member, elevation timestamp, and unique assignment ID.
